chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristen M Lake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Carrying License. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristen M Lake

records.addlTxt:
11:47 AM Defendant Kristen M Lake in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Kristen M Lake.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Parties have reached an agreement.
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Count 1 to No License on Person contrary to section 343.18(1), Wisconsin Statutes.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Case 22TR1974 is dismissed and read in to this matter.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
FINE: $ 267.50
	
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 90 days .   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

09:36 AM Defendant Kristen M Lake in court with attorney Pablo Galaviz.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has completed 5 of the 25 hours of community service necessary in 21CM1342.  The remaining 20 hours are scheduled with the food pantry in the next 2 weeks.
Defendant has paid the last fine and will be reinstating her license today which will facilitate completing the community service.
Defense requests a further proceedings in a few weeks.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

09:34 AM Defendant Kristen M Lake in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kristen M Lake
Current: 2967 S Kinnickinnic Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53207   (Effective: 04-05-2022)
Prior: 2525 S Howell Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53207
